text.p: Here are highlights of stories in Romania's press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:
Business:
ADEVARUL
- The new road rax will become effective starting August 1, the paper says.
- Hundreds of tonnes of fodder were destroyed by fire in the Constanta county.
- The state budget got only 7.5 billion lei ($1.04 million) as revenues from the privatisation process in June, Finance Minister Mircea Ciumara is quoted as saying.
- There are no reasons to believe that Romania's wheat exports might be affected by bad weather, Trita Fanita, general manager of the Agroexport SA grain trading company, said.
- The International Herald Tribune will organise a conference on foreign investment in Romania, in Bucharest over October 29-30.
- Capital markets in Romania are on the rise, the paper says.
CURIERUL NATIONAL
- The government should support the local small and medium-sized companies if it wants to consolidate Romania's economy, former agriculture minister Valeriu Tabara is quoted as saying.
- New taxes on cigarettes harm local producers, the paper says.
EVENIMENTUL ZILEI
- The Crisul Alb river flooded some 32 hectares of arable land in the Alba county.
- Companies will pay less for electricity starting this autumn.
ROMANIA LIBERA
- Some 40 Romanian ships are detained in ports across the world.
General:
ROMANIA LIBERA
- Hungary will open a new consulate in the Transylvanian city on Wednesday.
- Life expectancy in Romania is on decline, the paper says.
- Politicians in the centrist ruling coalition say they are satisfied with the decision of President Emil Constantinescu to refrain from mediating arguments within the coalition.
- Bilingual signs in the Transylvanian city of Tirgu Mures stir nationalist passions.
CURIERUL NATIONAL
- Ioan Talpes, the head of the Directia Informatii Externe intelligence service, will tender his resignation, the paper said.
EVENIMENTUL ZILEI
- Many Romanian nomad gypsyes live like in the Midle Ages, the paper says.
-- Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
